title: TeamViewer shares open flat after Europe's biggest IPO of the year
text:
TeamViewer shares open flat after Europe's biggest IPO of the year

Technology 21 minutes ago (Sep 25, 2019 04:27AM ET)

© Reuters. First day of trading of TeamViewer AG in Frankfurt FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Shares in German software company TeamViewer traded flat at their offer price in Frankfurt on Wednesday, their first day of trading, in what is Europe's biggest stock market debut this year. Shares opened at 26.25 euros, which was also the final subscription price the company revealed late on Tuesday, and stood at 25.45 euros at 0729 GMT. Private equity investor Permira sold a 42% stake in the connectivity specialist, raising 2.21 billion euros ($2.43 billion).

TeamViewer shares open flat after Europe's biggest IPO of the year
description: TeamViewer shares open flat after Europe's biggest IPO of the year
